title: The moon illusion - Andrew Vanden Heuvel

multiple-choice.question: What is the phenomenon known as the moon illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: The Earth's atmosphere acting as a lens to magnify the moon

options.label: B
options.text: The full moon appearing larger near the horizon than when it's high over the head

options.label: C
options.text: The Ebbinghaus illusion causing objects to appear larger near the horizon

options.label: D
options.text: The Ponzo illusion causing objects to appear smaller near the horizon

multiple-choice.question: Which ancient Greek philosopher studied the moon illusion?
What is the Ebbinghaus illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: An optical illusion where objects appear larger near the horizon

options.label: B
options.text: An optical illusion where objects appear smaller near the horizon

options.label: C
options.text: A theory that explains why the moon appears larger near the horizon

options.label: D
options.text: A theory that explains why moon appears smaller when overhead

multiple-choice.question: Why does the Ponzo illusion occur?

options.label: A
options.text: Because our brain automatically corrects for the size of objects near the horizon

options.label: B
options.text: Because the Earth's atmosphere acts as a lens to magnify objects

options.label: C
options.text: Because objects near the horizon appear larger due to the Ebbinghaus illusion

options.label: D
options.text: Because our brain judges the distance to objects and their apparent size by the focus of our eyes

multiple-choice.question: What is Convergence Micropsia?

options.label: A
options.text: A theory that explains why the moon appears larger near the horizon

options.label: B
options.text: A theory that explains why the moon appears smaller when overhead

options.label: C
options.text: An optical illusion where objects appear larger near the horizon

options.label: D
options.text: An optical illusion where objects appear smaller near the horizon

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of studies that have shown the moon illusion persists even when pilots and sailors are above the clouds?

options.label: C
options.text: The Convergence Micropsia theory is confirmed

options.label: D
options.text: The moon illusion is inconsistent with the Ebbinghaus and Ponzo illusions

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of studies that have shown the moon illusion disappears when viewed inside a planetarium?

options.label: B
options.text: The Convergence Micropsia theory is confirmed

options.label: D
options.text: The moon illusion is inconsistent with the Ponzo illusion

multiple-choice.question: Why does the moon appear larger near the horizon according to Convergence Micropsia?

options.label: A
options.text: Because our brain judges the distance to objects and their apparent size by the focus of our eyes

options.label: B
options.text: Because the Earth's atmosphere acts as a lens to magnify the moon

options.label: C
options.text: Because objects near the horizon appear larger due to the Ebbinghaus illusion

options.label: D
options.text: Because our brain automatically corrects for the size of objects near the horizon

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the debate over the moon illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: The explanation for the moon illusion is clear

options.label: B
options.text: The moon illusion is an optical illusion caused by the Ebbinghaus illusion

options.label: C
options.text: The moon illusion is an optical illusion caused by the Ponzo illusion

options.label: D
options.text: The debate over the moon illusion remains ongoing

multiple-choice.question: Why is the explanation for the moon illusion still unclear?

options.label: A
options.text: Because the moon illusion is an optical illusion caused by the Ebbinghaus illusion

options.label: B
options.text: Because the moon illusion is an optical illusion caused by the Ponzo illusion

options.label: C
options.text: Because the moon illusion is an optical illusion caused by Convergence Micropsia

options.label: D
options.text: Because the debate over the moon illusion remains ongoing

title: What's the definition of comedy? Banana. - Addison Anderson

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why comedy defies definition?

options.text: Because it is a subjective experience that varies from person to person.
